result.execSummary:
All charges against Joseph Matthew Ciotti in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph Matthew Ciotti is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Matthew Ciotti

records.addlTxt: 03:30 PM Defendant Joseph Matthew Ciotti appears via Zoom videoconferencing with Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in Court.  ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 21CM137 & 22CM25.  ADA Schieffer recites agreement.  Defendant pleading to Count Two of 21CM137, Disorderly Conduct w/Domestic Abuse Enhancer.  Attorneys stipulate non-violent.  Costs of $443.  State moves to dismiss Count One as well as 22CM25.  Atty. Helgeson and Defendant confirm agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form was filed with the Court; Court reviews with Defendant.  Court informs Defendant of constitutional rights.  Defendand pleads Guilty to Count Two of 21CM137.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court finds Defendant is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count Two of 21CM137 and enters conviction.  Count One dismissed.  22CM25 dismissed.  ADA Schieffer states position.  Atty. Helgeson states position.  Defendant makes statement.  Court addresses Defendant.  Court sentences Defendant, W/H.  Court orders $443 costs, six months to pay.  DNA sample to be provided w/in six months.  Appeal rights given.  Court questions Defendant's address.  ADA Schieffer notes State is in compliance with V/W rights.  Adjourned at 3:50 PM
Plea hearing on June 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

03:22 PM Defendant Joseph Matthew Ciotti in court via phone with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 21CM137 and 22CM25 heard at this time. Atty Helgeson: agreement reached, Defendant is in treatment in California. Defendant: discharge date is 6/13 and into IOP, unsure of plans after. ADA Schieffer: set plea via zoom after discharge date. Atty Helgeson agrees.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on May 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
filed by ADA Joseph Schieffer. eif

04:14 PM Defendant Joseph Matthew Ciotti in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 21CM137/22CM25.  Atty Helgeson requests both cases to be set for PTC for a global resolution. ADA Walker agrees. PTC to set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH W.L.N. EXCEPT 1 TIME TO RETRIEVE HIS VEHICLE (HIS BELONGINGS HAVE BEEN PUT INTO THE VEHICLE). HE MAY PICK HIS PROPERTY TODAY BETWEEN  5:39 PM and 6:30 PM.

3:23 PM Defendant Joseph Matthew Ciotti appears from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appears by phone, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's right. NG. DA Hatch is requesting a $5,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of NAC W.L.N., AS & NTE except for employment, no objection. Court so orders. Court confirms address and phone number. DE to update address w/CofC. Court adjourned at 3:38 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
